Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre’s Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre’s productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‘okela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award. Located in Silver Springs, FL, Ocala RV Community is a delightful destination that offers a wide range of activities and attractions to explore throughout the year. Discover more about our exceptional RV park and extended stay motel below. Learn More → About Ocala RV Community Ocala RV Community, located in the peaceful town of Silver Springs, FL, presents a captivating RV park encounter. Embraced by majestic pine trees, this destination offers a serene haven for nature lovers, combining contemporary amenities with a warm ambiance that guarantees unforgettable adventures in the heart of Florida. Full Hookups (30 & 50 AMP) Laundry Room Bath House Near Silver Springs State Park Resident Portal We make it simple and easy to book and pay rent at Ocala RV Community. Just follow the steps below to login to your account and pay your rent. Click the link below. Step 1 Enter your login information. Step 2 Pay rent online quick and easy. Step 3 Pay Rent → Nearby Attractions In Silver Springs, FL Nestled within Marion County, central Florida, lies Silver Springs, a treasure waiting to be discovered amidst the captivating splendor of nature. This radiant city basks in the gentle rays of the sun, cradled by vast orchards of citrus trees, verdant forests bustling with wildlife, tranquil lakes, and awe-inspiring vistas. It beckons to all adventurers yearning for outdoor exploration and a profound communion with the untouched wonders of the earth. Silver Springs State Park Explore the iconic Silver Springs, known for its crystal-clear waters and abundant wildlife. Take a glass-bottom boat tour to see the underwater beauty or hike along the park's scenic trails. You can also enjoy kayaking, canoeing, or paddleboarding in the park's waterways. Visit Website → Silver River Museum & Environmental Education Center Learn about the rich history and natural wonders of the Silver River region at this fascinating museum. Discover exhibits on archaeology, paleontology, and local wildlife. The center also offers guided tours and educational programs. Visit Website → Ocala National Forest Just a short drive from Silver Springs, Ocala National Forest is a paradise for nature enthusiasts. It features numerous hiking trails, scenic drives, and beautiful lakes for boating, fishing, and swimming. Don't miss Juniper Springs, Alexander Springs, or Salt Springs while exploring the forest. Visit Website → Santos Mountain Bike Trails If you're an avid mountain biker, head to the Santos Trailhead and Bike Skills Park. This extensive trail system offers over 80 miles of thrilling biking trails, suitable for riders of all skill levels. Enjoy the scenic views and exciting challenges along the way. Visit Website → Appleton Museum of Art Located in nearby Ocala, the Appleton Museum houses an impressive collection of art from around the world. Explore exhibits featuring European, American, African, and Asian art, as well as rotating exhibitions and educational programs. Visit Website → The Canyons Zip Line and Adventure Park For adrenaline seekers, The Canyons is a fantastic destination. Soar through the treetops on exhilarating zip lines, tackle high ropes courses, and enjoy breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. Visit Website → View More Activities → Contact Us Need to get in touch with us? You can call us at the number below, or leave us a quick message in the contact form. We’re always here to help and assist with anything you need. However, public internet services like ours are shared among many users, which can impact performance. For those who require a more consistent or high-speed connection, we recommend using a personal internet service. Claim Your Listing CAMPER SUMMARY PRESENTED BY Ocala North RV Park, near Reddick, Florida, is a spacious campground that caters primarily to RV travelers, offering a friendly atmosphere and a range of amenities. With features like electric hookups and clean shower facilities, it’s designed to make your stay comfortable and hassle-free. The park is well-known for its large pull-through sites, which many visitors appreciate for their convenience. Campers have highlighted the friendly staff and the cleanliness of the facilities, making it a pleasant spot to unwind after a day of exploring. One reviewer mentioned, “The showers are very clean,” which is always a plus when you’re on the road. Located in horse country, Ocala North RV Park is a great base for those looking to explore the surrounding area. It’s close to both Gainesville and Ocala, giving you easy access to local attractions and activities. Plus, the campground features a nice dog park for your furry friends to enjoy. While some campers have noted quirks like the absence of picnic tables at certain sites, the overall vibe is welcoming, and many return for repeat visits. Whether you’re stopping for a night or planning a longer stay, Ocala North RV Park offers a solid option for RV camping in central Florida. Guide Reviewed Feb. 13, 2023 Super Camp Huge park in horse country FL. Really nice place and great staff. We will stay here every trip thru FL. Super clean and functional! Site 115 Month of Visit February Share Report Kaitlynn B. Guide Reviewed Jun. 5, 2022 Great pull throughs! A bit unlevel but I was too amazed by the number of open pull through spots. Site 202 Month of Visit June Share Report J John Scout Reviewed Dec. 28, 2021 Great place to stop in central Florida Stopped here on the way north to get out of the Florida Keys. Stayed 2 nights and used the laundry(wash was 1.50 per load, and 25 cents per 18min for drying). It was very affordable. Very large dog park for off-leash. One weird quirk we noticed was not all sites had a picnic table. Ours was one of those. Here are some notes for data for people interested in staying here and needing connectivity. They have an amazing campground WiFi deployment. I was getting about 15mbs down and 6mbs up. Obviously depending on when people are using it all that can change. I have a Pepwave Max Transit CAT18 modem paired up with a Parsec Husky Pro 7-in-1 4x4 MIMO antenna mounted on our travel trailer. I ran a speedtest from Ookla on my laptop three times per provider while I was deciding which connection to use. I ended up leveraging Speedfusion on my router to bond my best connection with the campground WiFi Verizon LTE Band 66(AWS 1700/2100 MHz) RSSI:-77dBm SINR: 12.7dB RSRP:-108dBm RSRQ:-10.0dB 9.40ms down| 5.03mbs up| 39ms ping AT&T LTE Band 14(700 MHz) RSSI:-53dBm SINR: 20.7dB RSRP:-81dBm RSRQ:-10.0dB 8.51mbs down| 5.53mbs up| 43ms ping Read More Site 173 Month of Visit December Share Report Ellen L. Scout Reviewed Jul. 27, 2021 Country setting close to Gainesville and Ocala Ocala North RV Resort is in horse country, yet convenient to both Gainesville and Ocala. We stayed here last June and came back for the winter. Now we are staying indefinitely and loving it. There is mature landscaping in the original part of the resort. New heated saline pool opened last February. They are expanding with 200 more sites set to open in the late summer. Great place for a short stay or long vacation. Friendly people! Month of Visit June Share Report Donni D. Traveler Reviewed Dec. 9, 2020 Business Getaway I have stayed at Ocala North a lot over the past couple of years when I go to Gainesville for business. A lot of changes have taken place during this time. They are expanding the number of spaces they currently have, the pool was being  resurfaced when I was there last. A new, larger dog park has added, shuffle board courts, bocci balls, pond with fountain light show and ducks. Not too far from society and shopping. At night I can see some stars. This is a very nice, friendly, resort, I enjoy staying here. Share Report Donni D. Traveler Reviewed May. 30, 2020 Enjoyable I have stayed here a few times. Very enjoyable and I always look forward to coming back. It's going through some renovations. New owners have paved all the spaces, the shower house has been redone, they are digging a beautiful pond in front. They have a little dog park, walking trails, off property is a nice bike ride, huge swimming pool, activities, laundry room and friendly people. At night the stars are amazing. Close to 1-75 and reasonable rates. This is a good place to stay. Share Report Showing results 1- 9 of 9 reviews For information regarding reservations, contact this campground directly. Ocala FL Camping Sites at RV Camp Resort | Tent  Campsites at Florida RV Park | Pet Friendly RV Campgrounds Welcome to Ocala RV Camp Resort Florida âHorse Capital of the Worldâ OCALA is  located in the country setting of Northern Florida  and is home to more than 1,000 horse  farms and training centers .Â Â Ocala RV Camp Resort is in a private RV camping setting with a great  location surrounded by a natural environment of beauty with oak and magnolia  trees. Our pet friendly campground is conveniently located and  offers Easy On/Off to the Highway.Â Our Log Cabins are located around scenic ponds where you will see ducks  and other Florida  birds. We offer sites with 30 and 50 amp electric service including water, and sewage. Our sites are situated on grassy areas with lots of shady spots to keep you cool. Our amenities include a Olympic Size Swimming Pool (with a smaller pool for children), restrooms, and showers. We offer Wireless Internet, basketball, cabins, dump station and propane. Ocala North RV Resort General Rules & Guidelines Follow Follow Follow GET DIRECTIONS 352-421-3444 RATES & RESERVATIONS About Why Ocala North Resort Map Virtual Tour General Rules Upon Arrival FAQs Specials Blog Testimonials Local Fun Job Postings Guest Agreement Amenities Events Contact Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups About About Us Resort Map Virtual Tour General Rules Upon Arrival FAQs Specials Blog Testimonials Local Fun Job Postings Amenities Events Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Contact Rates & Reservations General Rules All visitors must register at the office OCCUPANCY : A limit of one RV per site no older than 15 years, unless pre-approved by management We do not accept tents, pop-ups, or conversions. Maximum 4 adults per site for overnighters, 2 adults per site for weekly/monthly stays Vehicles parked on a vacant site will be charged the nightly rate for that site All vehicles must fit on your site straight ( not sideways or on the grass ) Grass parking of car dollies, flatbed trailers, utility/storage trailers, boats, is prohibited, they must be placed in storage at an additional cost Tents with floors and/or without windows will be asked to be removed Radios and televisions should not be heard beyond your site. SMOKING is not permitted in any resort buildings, pool area or restrooms. The Speed Limit is 10 MPH throughout the entire campground. Daily Quiet Times are 10:00 pm to 8:00 am Please be considerate of neighbors. Radios and televisions should not be heard beyond your site. CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT TIMES : Check-in: 12 pm or later. A credit card must be provided for incidentals Check-out: 11 am unless pre-approved for later to avoid the $50 late fee CAMPFIRES: Campfires must be in a raised and covered fire pit Fires cannot be left unattended & must be extinguished before retiring for the night. CHILDREN : Parents are responsible for minors (under age 18) at all times. Do not leave children unattended. Children under the legal driving age are not allowed to operate ANY motorized vehicle on the campground property (including golf carts). By law, children under the age of 18 are not allowed to participate in Bingo RESTROOMS : Please remove all personal items from restrooms. Articles left in the restroom will be removed and disposed of. Restrooms and showers are cleaned daily. If you see anything that we should be aware of please notify the office. SWIMMING POOL : Pool hours are 9 AM – 9 PM. Note that there is NO LIFEGUARD ON DUTY Children under 18yrs must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian No glass or pets permitted in the pool area. Smoking is not allowed in the pool area. PETS : Maximum 3 pets per camper Pets must be kept on a leash at all times outside of your rig. No pets shall be outside of the unit unattended Tie-outs are not allowed. It is imperative for the health of all pets in the park, and out of courtesy to all, that you pick up after your pets, even when in our designated pet area. Waste bags and containers are situated throughout the park for your convenience. TRASH : For your convenience trash is picked up daily. Please have it out at the end of your site by 10am DO NOT leave trash out overnight …it attracts animals. Bags scattered by animals will be the responsibility of the site owner to “re-bag” the scattered contents for collection the following day…or call down to our office to confirm it has been re-bagged and ready for pickup. Trash containers in the park are for cardboard or bagged trash ONLY. PROPANE : Propane tanks can be left at the end of your site NO LATER THAN 10am , they will be picked up, filled and returned to your site the same day. You must have a credit card on file which will be charged according to your tank size. INSURANCE & THEFT : Ocala North RV Resort is not responsible in the case of theft of RV or contents thereof; nor for any damage caused by natural causes (i.e., tree limbs, etc); nor for spoilage of refrigerator/freezer foods due to loss of electricity. All activities in the campground are done at the individual’s free will, and Ocala North RV Park will not be responsible for injury to guests, or for loss of money or valuables of any kind. DISRUPTIVE BEHAVIOR : If the police are called by another camper or by management due to disruptive behavior, the camper will be required to leave the campground immediately. This includes Annual/Seasonal Campers, with the Annual/Seasonal Agreement becoming Void and No Refunds to any person in this situation. Please do not put yourselves and management in this situation. FIREWORKS : Strictly prohibited anywhere in the park. SITE MAINTENANCE : All sites must be kept neat and clean of debris and in an uncluttered state No tents, boats, or boat trailers are permitted on the site Nothing is to be stored outside or under the RV except outdoor equipment, such as patio-type furniture, grills, coolers Appliances of any kind, such as refrigerators, freezers, washer/dryers outside of your unit, are prohibited. No trash is to be stored on the site. No combustibles are to be stored under the RV or on the space at any time Clothes Lines are not permitted. GENERATORS : For the courtesy of all continuous use of generators is only allowed during unexpected electrical outages. VEHICLES : All vehicles parked on the property must have current registration and plates. RECEIVING MAIL : If you stay with us temporarily, we suggest that you do a TEMPORARY FORWARD through your post office, NOT A CHANGE OF ADDRESS Use 16905 NW Hwy 225, Reddick, FL 32686 as your address Do not put your site number on your Temporary Address change as all mail comes directly to the front office, sorted and available for pickup during normal business hours. RIGHT OF REFUSAL : Ocala North RV Resort management and employees reserve the right to refuse service to anyone noncompliant with campground rules and regulations, and the discretionary right to change our Rules & Regulations at any time to protect the safety of all campers. Other: We will not share or sell subscriber information with 3rd parties for their direct marketing purposes. No mobile information will be shared with third parties/affiliates for marketing/promotional purposes. All the above categories exclude text messaging originator opt-in data and consent; this information will not be shared with any third parties. DLP Capital | DLP Capital Acquires $33 Million High-End RV Resort in… DLP Capital Investment Funds Lending DLP Elite Client Portals Borrower Portal Investor Portal 1.800.350.8061 Search for: Solutions Investment Funds Construction Financing DLP Elite Member Program Scale Your Business Events About Our Impact Transactions Purpose & Values Our CEO Team Careers Current Positions Connect News Impact Series Impact Podcast Events Insights & Education Contact Menu Close Home News & Insights DLP Capital Acquires $33 Million High-End RV Resort in Central Florida Events Solutions Investment Funds Construction Financing DLP Elite Member Program Scale Your Business Contact About Our Impact Environmental Stewardship Transactions Purpose & Values Our CEO Team Careers Connect News Impact Series Impact Podcast Insights & Education Seasonal Reports Apply for a Loan DLP Capital Acquires $33 Million High-End RV Resort in Central Florida RV Parks Increasing in Appeal to Real Estate Investors as America Alters the Way It Vacations Feb 07, 2023 Share DLP Capital, a private real estate investment firm, announced that it has acquired Ocala North RV Resort for a purchase price of $33 million. The Ocala North RV Resort, spanning 73 acres in the heart of central Florida’s horse country, consists of 385 sites for RVs and cottages. Ocala is a pristine area known as having one of the most prolific equine industries in the world, with 600+ thoroughbred farms and training centers, as well as featuring Ocala National Forest, which has hundreds of lakes, rivers, and freshwater springs that serve as home to manatees and hundreds of other wildlife species. The region is an increasingly popular natural playground for RV enthusiasts and vacationers, with DLP Capital investing in the resort at a time when RVs are more popular than ever. More than 11.2 million households in the US own an RV, up 62 percent from 20 years ago, with a significant increase among 18- to 34-year-olds, who now make up nearly a quarter of the market.* DLP Capital’s acquisition of the RV resort follows on the heels of its development of Island Oaks RV Resort in north Florida near Jacksonville, which opened in 2022 and includes 385 RV pads. “RV resorts are an emerging asset class for investment. with tremendous untapped value given prolific growth in the RV leisure market,” said Don Wenner, Founder and CEO of DLP Capital. “America has changed the way it travels with the return of the road trip becoming increasingly popular, without the hassles of planes and trains. RV resorts are especially appealing to those interested in active outdoor getaways, and DLP Capital is refining the RV experience with amenity-driven resorts. It’s a new generation of RV resorts that are a far cry from prior generations of barebone parks.” Ocala is located approximately 20 miles south of Gainesville and 90 miles northwest of Orlando. The Ocala North RV Resort is easily accessible, featuring frontage along I-75 (exit 368), a major north-south interstate that connects the Southeast to the Great Lakes. The resort features a clubhouse, exercise center, saline swimming pool, pickleball, shuffleboard, and bocce ball courts, and Florida’s largest groomed dog park. DLP Capital will upgrade some amenities and may add more cottage accommodations. Plans also include development of a resort restaurant and general store and an outdoor community kitchen and fireplace. The resort also hosts special events and social activities throughout the year. More than 50 percent of the RV sites at the resort are “pull-throughs”—a highly desirable RV park feature, allowing easy maneuverability of recreational vehicles. According to the U.S. Census Bureau, the Ocala metro area is among the top 25 fastest-growing metro areas in the US. The Ocala region also features the largest equestrian complex in the US, the World Equestrian Center, with multi indoor/outdoor arenas hosting Olympic-caliber competitions. *RV Owner Demographic Profile Study, 2021 by Go Rving with Ipsos More about DLP Capital DLP Capital is a private real estate investment company focused on making an impact on four major crises in America: Affordable Housing, Jobs, Legacy and Happiness. The company achieves this through acquiring, developing, and building relationships, housing, leaders, and organizations. With more than $4 billion of assets under management, DLP Capital has been on the Inc. 5000 list of “Fastest Growing Private Companies in America” for 10 consecutive years. DLP Capital is headquartered in St. Augustine, Florida, with offices in Allentown, PA and Asheville, NC. The firm has an expansive array of business divisions and companies including real estate investment funds, commercial real estate lending, construction management, development, sales, leasing, title services, and loan servicing. Through its proprietary Elite Execution System, as well as its exclusive membership platforms focused on business scaling, investment housing, family, and wealth, DLP Capital impacts lives by empowering its clients to choose, create, grow and preserve prosperity. For more information, follow us on @DLPCapital or visit DLPCapital.com . About Us — Town & Country RV Resort Skip to the content (813) 892-1474 Dade City, Florida Tampa 81 ° f Home About About Us Our Staff Gallery Rental Details Resources Amenities Nearby Activities Resort Map Rules and Regulations Contact Book A Stay Home About About Us Our Staff Gallery Rental Details Resources Amenities Nearby Activities Resort Map Rules and Regulations Contact About Town & Country OUR RESORT About Us Town and Country RV Resort is a seasonal 55+ community located four miles north of downtown Dade City amidst the rolling hills and Spanish moss covered oaks of Western Central Florida. We made it our goal to provide an RV resort that is well-maintained, enjoyable and beautiful for our guests. Family-owned and operated 35 shaded acres of land COMMUNITY Our History The Town and Country RV Resort was built in 1986. The Hawkins family purchased the Town and Country RV Resort in 2000, and the resort continues to be family owned and operated. Our 55+ R.V. resort is situated on 35 acres, complete with a driving range and pool. We work hard every day so you can safely enjoy your retirement years. Our Staff Our Lovely RV Resort in Dade City, FL Our little spot nestled on a hill in the lovely Florida countryside will offer you days full of activities, a strong sense of community, and companionship with your neighbors. Sunshine Sunshine is a great part of our focus here; dip in our relaxing heated pool or enjoy a walk on the 35 acres. Early risers will be able to catch sights of the most amazing birds in the area. Some refer to our park as a tropical oasis. Recreational Hall Our recreational hall offers books and puzzles for some independent entertainment or our social clubs host everything from shuffleboard tournaments, bingo, euchre, bridge, to dinners and dances. The fun is all here, you decide how much to have. Animals We have 13 open space acres in the rear of the park for dog-walking or exercising. Even if you don’t own an animal, you can spend a few restful moments saying hello to Susie, Wifi, Snowy and Baby, the Town & Country feline mascots. Prime Location Located in Dade City, only 5 miles from the nearest grocery stores, antiques shops, pharmacies, shopping centers and hospitals. We offer a country, slow-paced feel but provides residents the necessary amenities close to home. Tampa is less than an hour drive and Orlando is just over an hour away. Relaxation Paradise Enjoy your days relaxing on your porch, having coffee with friends at the recreation hall, golfing at the adjacent course, walking the park grounds or shopping in downtown Dade City. We also welcome vacationing families and overnight guests on their way in and out of town. Activities We offer an on-site driving range and a place to play bocce ball or corn hole. The Park Association puts on many activities during the year, including weekly social golf tournaments, weekly bingo and poker and monthly dances. There are also shuffleboard courts, horseshoe rings, a pool table and a swimming pool. We offer a wide variety of amenities for our guests. Every single one is serviced regularly and ready for use. VIEW ALL AMENITIES Come Stay With Us All Town & Country RV sites are full hook-up and have either 30 or 50 amp service (50 amp available on all sites).  All of our sites are very spacious at 75 feet long and we have no limitations on RV length. Pull through lots in the back can house RVs pulling trailers. RENTAL DETAILS Town & Country RV Resort Town & Country RV Resort is a seasonal 55+ community located 4 miles north of downtown Dade City amidst the rolling hills of Western Central Florida. Family Friendly Activities & Attractions in Ocala, FL Follow Follow Follow GET DIRECTIONS 352-421-3444 RATES & RESERVATIONS About Why Ocala North Resort Map Virtual Tour General Rules Upon Arrival FAQs Specials Blog Testimonials Local Fun Job Postings Guest Agreement Amenities Events Contact Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups About About Us Resort Map Virtual Tour General Rules Upon Arrival FAQs Specials Blog Testimonials Local Fun Job Postings Amenities Events Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Contact Rates & Reservations Family Friendly Activities & Attractions Near Ocala North RV Resort Ocala North RV Resort is in the perfect North Central Florida location! Within just a 30 minute drive in any direction you have access to SO MANY fun places to see & do…from jaw-dropping world class horse farms, to quaint restaurants with outside seating, quirky antique stores, historical towns and historic landmarks…not to mention bats, elephants, butterflies and alligators! Let our staff members suggest their favorite places recommended to family and friends when they come to visit. Each location will show distance from Ocala North RV resort and the general direction, along with a link to their website for further information. You’ll DEFINITELY want to stay with us at the resort for a few days just to visit them all! HERE’S OUR STAFF RECOMMENDATIONS… CEDAR LAKES & WOODS 23 minutes West in Williston. Expect to spend a couple hours exploring the top AND bottom of the quarry…it’s so interesting that the time will go by very quickly. You’ll definitely want to be sure your camera is charged for taking pictures! For more information CLICK HERE TWO TAILS RANCH 25 minutes West in Williston. This elephant preserve has been in the family for seven generations! Limited number of visitors so we recommend you call & reserve your place a couple days in advance. Great presentation on elephants. Other animals there to see. Very little walking involved. For more information CLICK HERE TWO HAWK HAMMOCK 22 minutes West in Williston. Every Sat 4p-8p is Happy Hour in the barnyard. Live music. ($5/person). Great for the entire family! Bring a lawn chair. Trapeze flights with Gainesville Circus Center. Lots of fun! For more information CLICK HERE DEVIL'S DEN 22 minutes West in Williston. Great place to snorkel or scuba dive. Expect to spend 1-2 hrs. They rent snorkel gear if you don’t have your own. Close to Two Tails, Two Hawk Hammock and Cedar Lakes & Woods. It can get pretty busy so we recommend you go early. Two hidden gems for food in Williston are Sister’s Cafe for lunch and Flamingo Freeze for dessert. CLICK HERE HISTORIC MICANOPY 12 minutes North. Fun short visit with antique shops, historic museum, and the Herlong Mansion. Our staff recommends having a light lunch (and most definitely dessert) at Coffee ‘n Cream right there in town. For more information on Historic Micanopy (pronounced mick-an-o’-pee) CLICK HERE PAYNES PRAIRIE STATE PARK 14 minutes North in Micanopy. Expect to spend about an hour unless you decide to hike some of the trails or picnic by the lake. Perfect for combining with Historic Micanopy. Paved trails to ranger station, washroom facilities, and 3-story tower overlooking Paynes Prairie. Bring field glasses with you as there’s a chance you’ll see wild horses and other animals roaming the prairies. For more information CLICK HERE LA CHUA TRAIL 28 minutes North in Gainesvile. While it’s a bit further to go it’s highly recommended. Rarely have we found this hidden gem busy, yet on a hot sunny day it’s THE best place to see alligators in their natural habitat lining the river banks. Summer rains may result in closing the walk beyond the boardwalk due to flood conditions. No dogs allowed and highly recommended small children are not left on their own. (top photo of alligators was taken at La Chua Trail) CLICK HERE DEPOT PARK 26 minutes North in Gainesvile. Perfect in combination with a trip to La Chua Trail and right next door to the Cade Museum. A fun place to take the kids for fun & arcade games but great for adults as well. Both food and liquor venues here with a nice outdoor open pavillion for eating. For more information CLICK HERE ANTIQUE EMPORIUM Only a 3 minute drive from the RV resort and open daily from 10am-6pm. You would have passed the Antique Emporium as you turned onto Hwy 225 after exiting I-75. Lots of fun things to see throughout the 17,000 square foot facility! For more information CLICK HERE ANTIQUE CITY MALL 9 minutes North in Micanopy. Good in combination with a trip to Historic Micanopy or Paynes Prairie State Park. If you enjoy antiques, you’ll find a wide vaiety of them and a great colection of items not normally found in your traditional antique store. For more information CLICK HERE ZIP THE CANYONS 15 minutes South in Ocala. If ziplining is your thing, then Zip the Canyons is a fantastic experience! Highlight is the Big Cliff Canyon taking you on an 1,100’ zip across Lost Spring Lake! You wouldn’t think you’d find quarry cliffs this high in Florida, but you’ll be amazed! For more information CLICK HERE KANAPAHA BOTANICAL GARDENS 22 minutes North in Gainesville. Expect to spend around 2 hrs in this 68 acre botanical garden with 1.5 miles of paved walkways. Easy walking with benches and gazebos along the way for resting. Picnic baskets welcome and is dog-friendly. For more information CLICK HERE UNIV. OF FL BAT HOUSES 25 minutes north in Gainesville. Who would have thought that a hot summer night with lots of mosquitoes is the perfect place to be out ANYWHERE? Well, bring your long sleeve shirt and pants and your mosquito repellent for a Disney-like experience watching thousands of bats exiting their daytime residence. Arrive just before sunset and wait for the show! CLICK HERE DON GARLITZ MUSEUM OF DRAG RACING 30 mins South. “Big Daddy’s” living legacy and race car design innovations are so significant that his record breaking Swamp Rat XXX is enshrined in the Smithsonian Museum of American History. For more information CLICK HERE SILVER SPRINGS GLASS BOTTOM BOAT 28 mins South in Silver Springs. The 4,000-acre Silver Springs State Park encompasses not only the springs, but the entire 5-mile Silver River and surrounding sandhill forest. Glass bottom boat only $12. Kids 5 and under FREE. For more information CLICK HERE FARM TOURS OF OCALA 20 mins South in Ocala. Starting at $65 Per Person | 3 Hrs 30 min. Enjoy a guided Insider’s Tour of Ocala’s working farms, and discover why Marion County is the “Horse Capital of the World!” On this farm tour, you see one of only four major thoroughbred centers in the world! Marion County produced American Pharoah, Triple Crown Winner of 2015, and Nyquist, winner of the 2016 Kentucky Derby, and more. For more information CLICK HERE Sign Up For Our Newsletter! Best Pet-Friendly Activities Near Ocala North RV Resort: Explore Top Outdoor Adventures for You and Your Furry Friend Follow Follow Follow GET DIRECTIONS 352-421-3444 RATES & RESERVATIONS About Why Ocala North Resort Map Virtual Tour General Rules Upon Arrival FAQs Specials Blog Testimonials Local Fun Job Postings Guest Agreement Amenities Events Contact Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups About About Us Resort Map Virtual Tour General Rules Upon Arrival FAQs Specials Blog Testimonials Local Fun Job Postings Amenities Events Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Contact Rates & Reservations Best Pet-Friendly Activities Near Ocala North RV Resort: Explore Top Outdoor Adventures for You and Your Furry Friend by Jax Media Team | Mar 17, 2025 | RV Resort | 0 comments Planning a getaway with your four-legged companion? Ocala North RV Resort in Florida offers a perfect base for adventure with your pets. You’ll find numerous pet-friendly activities in and around Ocala, making it an ideal destination for campers who consider their pets part of the family. The Ocala North RV Resort welcomes pets and provides a comfortable stay while you explore the surrounding area. Located in Reddick, Florida, this RV park has earned a stellar 10/10/10 rating from Good Sam for its exceptional amenities and hospitality. When staying at this pet-friendly campground, you’ll need to keep your dogs leashed when outside your vehicle, but there are plenty of opportunities to let them roam and play in the nearby recreation areas. The resort’s proximity to natural attractions makes it convenient for you to enjoy outdoor activities with your pet while returning to comfortable accommodations each evening. Explore Pet-Friendly Outdoor Activities Ocala offers numerous outdoor adventures where you and your furry companions can enjoy Florida’s natural beauty together. From scenic hiking trails to refreshing springs, you’ll find plenty of options to keep both you and your pet active during your stay at Ocala North RV Resort. Hiking and Trails in Ocala Silver Springs State Park welcomes leashed dogs on several beautiful trails perfect for exploration. The Sandhill Trail offers a manageable 1.7-mile loop through diverse ecosystems. Your pet will enjoy the sights and smells while you take in the natural beauty of central Florida. The Sinkhole Trail takes you through upland areas with unique geological features. For a different experience, try the Swamp Trail with its elevated boardwalk keeping your feet dry while exploring wetland habitats. Tuscawilla Park provides another excellent option with dog-friendly trails circling a calm lake. The park features an Art Park where you can admire large outdoor sculptures while walking your dog through this hidden gem in the heart of Marion County. Pet-Friendly Parks and Springs Rainbow Springs State Park offers shaded trails and three stunning waterfalls that make for perfect photo opportunities with your pet. The cool, clear water and abundant wildlife create a refreshing escape from the Florida heat. For water adventures, both Rainbow River Kayak and Get Up and Go Kayaking allow dogs to join you while paddling down the scenic Rainbow River. These excursions launch from KP Hole, where leashed pets are welcome. Silver Springs, famous for its glass-bottom boats, also provides pet-friendly areas along its shores. Your dog must remain leashed, but you’ll both enjoy the crystal-clear waters and possibly spot wildlife including the park’s famous wild monkeys (best observed from a safe distance). Dog Parks and Open Spaces Scott Springs Park, rated highly by visitors, offers open spaces where your dog can stretch its legs. The park features shaded areas and walking paths perfect for morning or evening strolls. Sholom Park provides a peaceful setting with beautifully maintained gardens and walking paths where leashed pets are welcome. The tranquil atmosphere makes it ideal for a relaxing walk with your four-legged friend. Ocala, known as the “Horse Capital of the World,” embraces its pet-friendly reputation with numerous open spaces. While visiting these areas, keep your dog leashed and bring water, especially during warmer months. Many of these parks also offer nearby fishing and boating opportunities, though pets may have restrictions in certain water recreation areas. Resort Amenities and On-Site Activities Ocala North RV Resort offers extensive amenities and activities designed to enhance your stay while keeping your furry friends comfortable. The resort’s 10/10/10 rating from Good Sam reflects its commitment to providing top-notch facilities for all guests. Leisure and Recreational Facilities The resort boasts impressive recreational options for active campers. You’ll find a sparkling swimming pool perfect for cooling off during Florida’s warm days. For indoor entertainment, head to the recreation hall equipped with a pool table and various gaming options. Outdoor enthusiasts can enjoy the well-maintained shuffleboard courts and basketball facilities. The resort also features picnic tables and pavilions scattered throughout the grounds, ideal for outdoor meals with your pets nearby. A designated dog run lets your four-legged companions exercise freely in a safe environment. Your RV experience is enhanced with practical amenities including 30/50 amp hookups, cable TV connections, and propane services. The grounds are beautifully maintained, providing pleasant walking paths for daily strolls with your pets. Fitness-minded guests can utilize the fitness center to maintain their workout routines. Social Gatherings and Planned Activities Ocala North RV Resort prides itself on fostering a warm community atmosphere through numerous social activities. You can participate in regularly scheduled events designed to help you connect with fellow campers. The resort offers an outstanding activities program that keeps guests engaged throughout their stay. These organized gatherings range from potluck dinners to holiday celebrations and themed parties. Morning coffee meetups provide casual opportunities to plan your day and meet neighbors. Craft workshops, card tournaments, and movie nights in the recreation hall offer entertainment for all interests. Family-friendly activities ensure guests of all ages feel welcome and entertained. The friendly staff regularly organizes pet-focused events where your furry friends can socialize with other pets at the resort. Seasonal celebrations add festive touches to longer stays, creating memorable experiences for returning guests. Activity schedules are posted weekly, helping you plan your participation. Ocala North RV Resort Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Follow Follow Follow GET DIRECTIONS 352-421-3444 RATES & RESERVATIONS About Why Ocala North Resort Map Virtual Tour General Rules Upon Arrival FAQs Specials Blog Testimonials Local Fun Job Postings Guest Agreement Amenities Events Contact Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups About About Us Resort Map Virtual Tour General Rules Upon Arrival FAQs Specials Blog Testimonials Local Fun Job Postings Amenities Events Cottage Homes Long Term Stays Rallies & Groups Contact Rates & Reservations FAQs WHAT ARE YOUR RATES? You can find our current rates on our Pricing page CAN YOUR SITE ACCOMMODATE LARGE RVS? Our sites are all various sizes. We can accommodate the smallest teardrop model to the largest Class A towing a car or trailer. Simply let us know the total length you’ll need (include rig size, tow length, and any additional accompanying vehicles) and we’ll assign the appropriate site. With our newly added sections, we now have over 200 pull-through sites available. We suggest that you make your reservations early as they book quickly! DO YOU ALLOW PETS? You bet! As a matter of fact we have one of Florida’s largest groomed pet areas, plus we’ve place a number of waste bag dispensers and waste containers throughout the park. There is, however, a limit of two pets per RV (including cats). All pets must be leashed at all times throughout the park. You can find more information on our General Rules page. IS THIS A 55+ RV PARK? It is not, and families with children are welcome. We only require that children under 16 be accompanied by an adult at all times throughout the park. More about children on our General Rules page. HOW CLOSE IS THE RESORT IN RELATION TO GAINESVILLE AND/OR OCALA? Ocala North is located almost half way between Gainesville and Ocala, with Ocala being closer by only a couple miles. The drive is 18 miles to Shands Hospital in Gainesville to our North and 16 miles to Ocala Regional Medical Center to our South. Other than nearby Dollar stores, our nearest grocery stores are Winn Dixie in Williston about 12 miles East, and Publix in Ocala, roughly 18 miles to the South. Our closest Hardware store is Ace Hardware in Williston, 12 miles East, Gilberts Hardware, about 8 miles South, or Lowes in Ocala, around 18 miles South. For area sightseeing and activities, check out our Local Fun page for fun places suggested by our staff members. WHAT PAYMENT TYPES ARE ACCEPTED? This is a cashless resort. We accept checks, money orders, credit cards, and debit cards only. WHAT EXIT OF I-75 ARE YOU ON? Exit 368 How many people are allowed on my site and can I have visitors? Limit of 4 adults per site for overnight stays. 2 Adults per site weekly/monthly stays. Maximum number of people per site 8 (Visitors). All visitors beyond the maximum limit must pay a daily visitor fee. What time is check-in and check-out? Check in for RV sites is at 12PM, check out is 11am. Is there Wi-Fi? Yes, we have WIFI throughout the resort. We understand that reliable internet is important, and we do our best to provide it as an added amenity. However, public internet services like ours are shared among many users, which can impact performance. For those who require a more consistent or high-speed connection, we recommend using a personal internet service. What is the cancellation policy? Daily and weekly guests who cancel their  booking more than 48 hours before the scheduled arrival date, will receive a full refund, less a $10.00 processing fee. Cancellations of a monthly reservation,  requires a two-week notice to receive a full refund, less a $50.00 processing fee.  Cancellations without proper notice as described above will result in forfeiture of deposit.  Daily & weekly guests’ deposit is equal to the full reservation.  Monthly guests deposit is equal to one full month.  Annual guests’ deposit is $500 (nonrefundable).  Refunds will be made to the credit card used to make the original reservation.  Please note: We cannot offer refunds for early check-outs or no shows. For annual guests, upon completing a full 12 month stay,  your deposit can be refunded or applied to month 13. If you leave prior to fulfilling a full  12 month stay, you forfeit your deposit. Can I bring my own golf cart? Yes! Sign Up For Our Newsletter!
